SandyAi.dice package¶

Submodules¶

SandyAi.dice.dice_functions module¶

SandyAi.dice.dice_functions.dice_budget(modifiers, dice_hand, dice_amt)[source]¶

Totals the amount of dice in the dice hand that can go towards purchasing each feature.

Parameters:

  • modifiers – dict[str, list[int]] Contains the features and their associated value that can be used for purchase.

  • dice_hand – list[int] The values obtained from rolling the dice.

  • dice_amt – int The amount of dice rolled.

Returns:

dict[str, int] Represents the total number of dice that match to each features’ value(s).

Example:

>>> modifiers = {'Plants': [1], 'Crab': [2], 'Turtle': [3], 'Seal': [4], 'Tectonic': [5], 'Bird': [6]}
>>> dice_hand = [1, 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 6]
>>> dice_amt = 7
>>> dice_budget(modifiers, dice_hand, dice_amt)
{'Plants': 2, 'Crab': 1, 'Turtle': 0, 'Seal': 1, 'Tectonic': 1, 'Bird': 2, 'dice_remaining': 7, 'dice_hand': [1,1,2,4,5,6,6]}
SandyAi.dice.dice_functions.dice_count(round_num)[source]¶

Sets the amount of dice able to be used based of the current round of the game.

Parameters:

round_num – int Current round of the game.

Returns:

int Amount of dice that can be used for his round.

Example:

>>> round_num = 5
>>> dice_count(round_num)
8
SandyAi.dice.dice_functions.roll_dice(dice_amt, saved_dice)[source]¶

Simulates rolling of a certain amount of 6 sided dice. :param dice_amt: int

The amount of dice that are available to be rolled prior to deducting the amount of dice saved from prior round.

Parameters:

saved_dice – list[int] The dice values saved from prior round.

Returns:

list[int] The dice to be used in the next round of moves. Includes any saved dice values and new generated values that total up to the dice_amt.

Example:

>>> dice_amt = 6
>>> saved_dice = [2,3]
>>> roll_dice(dice_amt, saved_dice)
[*,*,*,*,2,3]
* representing any number between 1 & 6.
